content: Sometimes it helps to give the breath a shape. Slow in for a few seconds. A small, quiet pause at the top. Then letting it all out, even slower. It's like a soft wave coming in and going out. You don't have to force it, just let it happen.
title: Breathing with a Shape

content: When things feel overwhelming, I find it helps to just focus on the belly. Place a hand there if you can. Feel it rise as you breathe in, and fall as you breathe out. The rest of the world can wait for a minute. Just you and that steady rhythm.
title: Belly Breathing

content: There's a rhythm called the 4-7-8 breath. It sounds technical, but it's really just about slowing everything down. A gentle breath in... a long, peaceful hold... and a very slow release. It's a way of telling your body that it's okay to rest now.
title: The Rhythm of Rest
